unique_internal_blocks.title: Monetary Policy
unique_internal_blocks.text: Monetary policy in Singapore is centred on managing the trade-weighted exchange rate with the objective to ensure price stability over the medium term.

unique_internal_blocks.title: How does MAS carry out monetary policy?
unique_internal_blocks.text: MAS has conducted monetary policy by managing the Singapore dollar exchange rate. MAS does not control domestic interest rates or money supply growth.

unique_internal_blocks.title: Monetary Policy Framework - Monetary Authority of Singapore
unique_internal_blocks.text: Monetary policy in Singapore is centred on the exchange rate. In the small and open Singapore economy, the exchange rate is the more effective ...

unique_internal_blocks.title: What is MAS' monetary policy framework and its rationale?
unique_internal_blocks.text: At each monetary policy review, MAS formulates monetary policy by setting a path for the S$NEER policy band to ensure price stability in the medium term.

unique_internal_blocks.title: How does MAS carry out its monetary policy?
unique_internal_blocks.text: Monetary policy in Singapore is carried out in three stages. The first stage is the formulation of monetary policy by the Economic Policy Group (EPG) at MAS.
